segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10

segments.pli: 10. Upālivagga
segments.en: 10. With Upāli

segments.pli: 93. Kiṃdiṭṭhikasutta
segments.en: 93. What Is Your View?

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati divā divassa sāvatthiyā nikkhami bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
segments.en: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika left Sāvatthī in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to him,

segments.pli: “akālo kho tāva bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
segments.en: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,

segments.pli: Paṭisallīno bhagavā.
segments.en: as he’s in retreat.

segments.pli: Manobhāvanīyānampi bhikkhūnaṃ akālo dassanāya.
segments.en: And it’s the wrong time to see the esteemed mendicants,

segments.pli: Paṭisallīnā manobhāvanīyā bhikkhū.
segments.en: as they’re in retreat.

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo tenupasaṅkami.
segments.en: Then he went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatitthiyā paribbājakā saṅgamma samāgamma unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā anekavihitaṃ tiracchānakathaṃ kathentā nisinnā honti.
segments.en: Now at that time, the wanderers who follow other paths had come together, making an uproar, a dreadful racket as they sat and talked about all kinds of unworthy topics.

segments.pli: Addasaṃsu kho te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
segments.en: They saw Anāthapiṇḍika coming off in the distance,

segments.pli: Disvāna aññamaññaṃ saṇṭhāpesuṃ:
segments.en: and stopped each other, saying,

segments.pli: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha.
segments.en: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati ārāmaṃ āgacchati samaṇassa gotamassa sāvako.
segments.en: The householder Anāthapiṇḍika, a disciple of the ascetic Gotama, is coming into our monastery.

segments.pli: Yāvatā kho pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakā gihī odātavasanā sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasanti, ayaṃ tesaṃ aññataro anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati.
segments.en: He is included among the white-clothed lay disciples of the ascetic Gotama, who is residing in Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Appasaddakāmā kho pana te āyasmanto appasaddavinītā appasaddassa vaṇṇavādino.
segments.en: Such venerables like the quiet, are educated to be quiet, and praise the quiet.

segments.pli: Appeva nāma appasaddaṃ parisaṃ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññeyyā”ti.
segments.en: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”

segments.pli: Atha kho te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṃ.
segments.en: Then those wanderers who follow other paths fell silent.

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then Anāthapiṇḍika went up to them, and exchanged greetings with those wanderers.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ te aññatitthiyā paribbājakā etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side. The wanderers said to him,

segments.pli: “vadehi, gahapati, kiṃdiṭṭhiko samaṇo gotamo”ti?
segments.en: “Tell us, householder, what is the view of the ascetic Gotama?”

segments.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavato sabbaṃ diṭṭhiṃ jānāmī”ti.
segments.en: “Sirs, I don’t know all his views.”

segments.pli: “Iti kira tvaṃ, gahapati, na samaṇassa gotamassa sabbaṃ diṭṭhiṃ jānāsi;
segments.en: “Well then, since it seems you don’t know all the views of the ascetic Gotama,

segments.pli: vadehi, gahapati, kiṃdiṭṭhikā bhikkhū”ti?
segments.en: tell us, what are the views of the mendicants?”

segments.pli: “Bhikkhūnampi kho ahaṃ, bhante, na sabbaṃ diṭṭhiṃ jānāmī”ti.
segments.en: “Sirs, I don’t know all the mendicants’ views.”

segments.pli: “Iti kira tvaṃ, gahapati, na samaṇassa gotamassa sabbaṃ diṭṭhiṃ jānāsi napi bhikkhūnaṃ sabbaṃ diṭṭhiṃ jānāsi;
segments.en: “Well then, since it seems you don’t know all the views of the ascetic Gotama or of the mendicants,

segments.pli: vadehi, gahapati, kiṃdiṭṭhikosi tuvan”ti?
segments.en: tell us, householder, what is your view?”

segments.pli: “Etaṃ kho, bhante, amhehi na dukkaraṃ byākātuṃ yaṃdiṭṭhikā mayaṃ.
segments.en: “Sirs, it’s not hard for me to explain what my views are.

segments.pli: Iṅgha tāva āyasmanto yathāsakāni diṭṭhigatāni byākarontu, pacchāpetaṃ amhehi na dukkaraṃ bhavissati byākātuṃ yaṃdiṭṭhikā mayan”ti.
segments.en: But please, let the venerables explain their own convictions first. Afterwards it won’t be hard for me to explain my views.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro paribbājako anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, one of the wanderers said to him,

segments.pli: “sassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: “The world is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, gahapatī”ti.
segments.en: That’s my view, householder.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho paribbājako anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another wanderer said,

segments.pli: “asassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: “The world is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, gahapatī”ti.
segments.en: That’s my view, householder.”

segments.pli: Aññataropi kho paribbājako anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Another wanderer said,

segments.pli: “antavā loko … pe …
segments.en: “The world is finite …” …

segments.pli: anantavā loko …
segments.en: “The world is infinite …” …

segments.pli: taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīraṃ …
segments.en: “The soul and the body are the same thing …” …

segments.pli: aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīraṃ …
segments.en: “The soul and the body are different things …” …

segments.pli: hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: “A Realized One exists after death …” …

segments.pli: na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death …” …

segments.pli: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: “A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …” …

segments.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, gahapatī”ti.
segments.en: That’s my view, householder.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati te paribbājake etadavoca:
segments.en: When this was said, Anāthapiṇḍika said this,

segments.pli: “yvāyaṃ, bhante, āyasmā evamāha:
segments.en: “Sirs, regarding the venerable who said this:

segments.pli: ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: ‘The world is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, gahapatī’ti,
segments.en: That’s my view, householder.’

segments.pli: imassa ayamāyasmato diṭṭhi attano vā ayonisomanasikārahetu uppannā paratoghosapaccayā vā.
segments.en: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.

segments.pli: Sā kho panesā diṭṭhi bhūtā saṅkhatā cetayitā paṭiccasamuppannā.
segments.en: But that view is created, conditioned, chosen, dependently originated.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho pana kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ cetayitaṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ tadaniccaṃ.
segments.en: Anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.

segments.pli: Yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s impermanent is suffering.

segments.pli: Yaṃ dukkhaṃ tadeveso āyasmā allīno, tadeveso āyasmā ajjhupagato.
segments.en: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.

segments.pli: Yopāyaṃ, bhante, āyasmā evamāha:
segments.en: Regarding the venerable who said this:

segments.pli: ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: ‘The world is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, gahapatī’ti,
segments.en: That’s my view, householder.’

segments.pli: imassāpi ayamāyasmato diṭṭhi attano vā ayonisomanasikārahetu uppannā paratoghosapaccayā vā.
segments.en: This view of his has either arisen from his own improper attention, or is conditioned by what someone else says.

segments.pli: Sā kho panesā diṭṭhi bhūtā saṅkhatā cetayitā paṭiccasamuppannā.
segments.en: But that view is created, conditioned, chosen, dependently originated.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho pana kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ cetayitaṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ tadaniccaṃ.
segments.en: Anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.

segments.pli: Yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s impermanent is suffering.

segments.pli: Yaṃ dukkhaṃ tadeveso āyasmā allīno, tadeveso āyasmā ajjhupagato.
segments.en: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.

segments.pli: Yopāyaṃ, bhante, āyasmā evamāha:
segments.en: Regarding the venerable who said this:

segments.pli: ‘antavā loko … pe …
segments.en: ‘The world is finite …’ …

segments.pli: anantavā loko …
segments.en: ‘The world is infinite …’ …

segments.pli: taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīraṃ …
segments.en: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing …’ …

segments.pli: aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīraṃ …
segments.en: ‘The soul and the body are different things …’ …

segments.pli: hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death …’ …

segments.pli: na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death …’ …

segments.pli: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …’ …

segments.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, gahapatī’ti,
segments.en: That’s my view, householder.’

segments.en: But that view is created, conditioned, chosen, dependently originated.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho pana kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ cetayitaṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ tadaniccaṃ.
segments.en: Anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.

segments.pli: Yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s impermanent is suffering.

segments.pli: Yaṃ dukkhaṃ tadeveso āyasmā allīno, tadeveso āyasmā ajjhupagato”ti.
segments.en: What he clings to and holds to is just suffering.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte te paribbājakā anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: When he said this the wanderers said to him,

segments.pli: “byākatāni kho, gahapati, amhehi sabbeheva yathāsakāni diṭṭhigatāni.
segments.en: “Householder, we’ve each explained our own convictions.

segments.pli: Vadehi, gahapati, kiṃdiṭṭhikosi tuvan”ti?
segments.en: Tell us, householder, what is your view?”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ kho, bhante, kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ cetayitaṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ tadaniccaṃ.
segments.en: “Sirs, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.

segments.pli: Yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s impermanent is suffering.

segments.pli: ‘Yaṃ dukkhaṃ taṃ netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti—
segments.en: And what’s suffering is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.

segments.pli: evaṃdiṭṭhiko ahaṃ, bhante”ti.
segments.en: That’s my view, sirs.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ kho, gahapati, kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ cetayitaṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ tadaniccaṃ.
segments.en: “Householder, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.

segments.pli: Yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s impermanent is suffering.

segments.pli: Yaṃ dukkhaṃ tadeva tvaṃ, gahapati, allīno, tadeva tvaṃ, gahapati, ajjhupagato”ti.
segments.en: What you cling to and hold to is just suffering.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ kho, bhante, kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ cetayitaṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ tadaniccaṃ.
segments.en: “Sirs, anything that is created, conditioned, chosen, and dependently originated is impermanent.

segments.pli: Yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ.
segments.en: And what’s impermanent is suffering.

segments.pli: ‘Yaṃ dukkhaṃ taṃ netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, nameso attā’ti—evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṃ.
segments.en: And I’ve truly seen clearly with right wisdom that what’s suffering is not mine, I am not this, it’s not my self.

segments.pli: Tassa ca uttari nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ pajānāmī”ti.
segments.en: And I truly understand the escape beyond that.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte te paribbājakā tuṇhībhūtā maṅkubhūtā pattakkhandhā adhomukhā pajjhāyantā appaṭibhānā nisīdiṃsu.
segments.en: When this was said, those wanderers sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati te paribbājake tuṇhībhūte maṅkubhūte pattakkhandhe adhomukhe pajjhāyante appaṭibhāne viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yāvatako ahosi tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesi.
segments.en: Seeing this, Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat. He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and informed the Buddha of all they had discussed.

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, gahapati.
segments.en: “Good, good, householder!

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho te, gahapati, moghapurisā kālena kālaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetabbā”ti.
segments.en: That’s how you should legitimately and completely refute those foolish men from time to time.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired the householder Anāthapiṇḍika with a Dhamma talk,

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
segments.en: after which Anāthapiṇḍika got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha before leaving.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkante anāthapiṇḍike gahapatimhi bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: Then, not long after Anāthapiṇḍika had left, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “yopi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vassasatupasampanno imasmiṃ dhammavinaye, sopi evamevaṃ aññatitthiye paribbājake sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya yathā taṃ anāthapiṇḍikena gahapatinā niggahitā”ti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, even a mendicant who has ordained for a hundred years in this teaching and training would legitimately and completely refute those wanderers who follow other paths just as the householder Anāthapiṇḍika did.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: Anāthapiṇḍika visits some wanderers, who ask him about the Buddha’s views. Anāthapiṇḍika asks them to explain their own view first. He then declares his own understanding of impermanence, leaving the wanderers speechless.
